revised_title: Experimental Examination of the Growth of the Chick Blastoderm
tldr: The author conducts experiments on the growth of the chick blastoderm and finds that the primitive streak forms from the portion of the unincubated blastoderm between the center and the posterior margin of the area pellucida, contradicting Duval's theory. The study also shows that the primitive streak gives rise to the anterior part of the embryo, including the heart, brain, and medulla.
